page.title: 18Woolley Colliery.
page.content: The mine was started in 1869. Now there are three shafts, and three seams are producing coal from five faces. In the past workers had to travel up to 4800 metres from the shaft to the coal face, but now the furthest they go is 3700 metres. The seams are called Lidgett, Fenton, and Thorncliffe. Lidgett seam is only 0.90 metres thick. When the mine was nationalised in 1947 2400 men produced 650000 tons of coal. In 1969 one million tons of coal was produced by only 1900 men because machinery and conveyor belts were installed. Now only 1340 men are employed. Almost all the coal goes for the production of electricity (65%) or coke (25%).
